meaning_mnemonic: When I look at this radical, I see the body and (mainly) head of a bull. What are bulls made of? They're made of <radical>leather</radical>.
This radical is made up of two <radical>vines</radical> hanging down and a branch linking them together. Imagine swinging on these Tarzan style. AaaaAA aAA AAAaaaa!

You see a lid on the street with a drawing of a forehead and a mouth on it. Hmm strange. You pick the lid up and reveal... a secret, underground <radical>restaurant</radical>! The mouth + forehead combo was secret street restaurant code for, "There's good eats down in this here restaurant hole!"
This radical is the same as the kanji. It means <radical>road</radical>.

This is a <radical>demon</radical>. Can you see him? He has a crazy face and some tentacles holding something demonic. Try to figure out how to see a demon. But don't see him too good, cause then he'll come out of your computer and eat you.
It has a leaf and it's connected to something that has lots of little sections. This looks just like a short, stubby thing of <radical>corn</radical>.
This is the left side of the kanji 朝, so we'll call it <radical>morning</radical> too.
